text: Slobodan Milošević (Serbian: Слободан Милошевић, pronounced []; August 20, 1941 – March 11, 2006) was a Serbian Yugoslav dictator. * * * * * ==Overview== He was the President of Serbia from 1989 to 1996, and then the President of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia from 1996 to 2000. After his fall from power in 2001, he was sent to The Netherlands to stand trial at the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) in The Hague over charges of genocide. * * * * * However, he died after five years in prison before the trial was completed. The UN tribunal said that Milosevic died of a heart attack. ==War crimes trials== ===International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia=== ====2007 rulings==== Following his death, in four separate rulings, he was found to be a part of a joint criminal enterprise which used crimes to remove Croats, Bosniaks and Albanians from large parts of Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Kosovo.
